word:
Two Typical Examples 

     1. Personal Testimony Gratefully Received.-- We returned December 12 [1892]. On the evening of the next day, Brother Faulkhead called to see me. [SEE SELECTED MESSAGES, BOOK 2, PP. 125-140, FOR THE MESSAGE GIVEN TO N. D. FAULKHEAD.] The burden of his case was upon my mind. I told him that I had a message for him and his wife, which I had several times prepared to send them, but I had felt forbidden by the Spirit of the Lord to do so. I asked him to appoint a 
                                                                           85
time when I could see them.
